intro: Albuca gethylloides, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive appearance and ease of care. Albuca gethylloides is also known for its ability to thrive in dry conditions, making it a resilient choice for gardens in arid climates.
